commit_message: Agh, README formatting fixes

Fixed some mistakes in the README, added more detailed installation instructions, updated the SLURM template scripts, updated the pipeline_environment.sh for added features plus some dependency links.

Several Quality of Life updates, plus a few partial and complete feature additions: max memory can be specified for all Java steps (GATK and Picard), no_markdup options synchronized across tasks, renamed iADMD to MAP, added full support for joint genotyping with samtools and GATK 3 (tested with 3.4), added logging and usage when most scripts are called without arguments, added framework for supporting other mappers (bowtie2, minimap2, HISAT2), added PacBio mapper task (PBMAP) with NGMLR and minimap2 support.  PacBio variant calling is *not* tested (though the filenames may be compatible with the rest of the pipeline), the task was just used for data prep for Sniffles.
Adjusted DEPTH task to simplify calculating genome-wide average post-markdup depth -- facilitates determining the filtering thresholds for PSEUDOFASTA.

Added support for skipping steps in iADMD and STAR, plus intronMotif, which should make a STAR BAM compatible with Cufflinks and StringTie (not yet tested). These changes aren't really to complement the original purpose of the PseudoreferencePipeline, but rather to make it useful for other tasks (e.g. RNAseq alignment as input into the BRAKER1 or BRAKER2 pipelines, StringTie, etc.).
Added support for BWA-MEM -a option in iADMD via all_alignments -- essentially trying to support prep steps for ncASE

Added only_markdup option for iADMD, adjusted README to account for this, an HC multi-threading bug diagnostic, and to note that FreeBayes with --report-monomorphic is incredibly slow so dev on that end is stopped.
Adjusted README and fixed up polydiv.sh
Added support for interleaved FASTQs for BWA and including comments from FASTQ headers (helpful for mapping 10x data from LongRanger Basic). Beginning to work on FreeBayes support.
Adjusted polydiv.sh, added DEPTH task
Updated README a bit to be more clear about dependencies and how to run the pipeline
Fixed auto-detection of BCFtools version (and thus multithreading capability of MPILEUP task)
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/YourePrettyGood/PseudoreferencePipeline
Adapted MPILEUP task for BCFtools 1.7+, and allowed for multithreaded MPILEUP calls
Fixes needed for full window indel masking (retaining masking only positives around indels as an option via indelmaskp_#)
Fixed sorting issue for bedtools in PSEUDOFASTA, and updated README for indel masking in PSEUDOFASTA
Updated PSEUDOFASTA to mask variant calls around indels (but haven't updated README.md)
Quick fix for bedtools sorting error in PSEUDOFASTA for HC
Revised PSEUDOFASTA task -- should now update GATK and samtools correctly, and now depends on bcftools 1.7+
Silly bug, wrong variable name used in samtoolsVariantCall.sh
Added polydiv calculation, non-SLURM wrapper, standardized MD and IR options, and added preliminary pseudoref generation code (needs much more testing, not written for samtools yet)
Fixed a couple of typos -- misencoded now works for HC
Added samtools-bcftools variant calling option.
Added the anonymized pipeline_environment.sh.
Updated the README for real this time.
Added example SBATCH scripts for running the DNAseq pipeline, and updated the README.

Initial scripts for DNAseq and RNAseq variant calling pipelines.
Excludes pipeline_environment.sh for now (need to anonymize the paths), and a template SBATCH script (need to anonymize that too before pushing).

 Committer: Patrick Reilly <preilly@princeton.edu>
Initial commit
